description:
Again during the life changes since Nonviolence is divided into five modules, each of which contains readings, videos, audios and Exercises:
The first module identifies the elements of human culture showing the direct connection between culture and life as a relationship that sustains planetary survival. Module 2 analyzes the elements of the hegemonic culture that go against life. Module 3 presents the thought of Jesus of Nazareth, Henry David Thoreau, Leo Tolstoy, Gandhi and Martin Luther King as alternatives to the hegemonic cultural model. The fourth module raises the 60s as a defining moment of eruption and rupture in the emerging social movements. As an epilogue, Module 5 presents an approach to the realities that are emerging in the new social movements and new utopias expressing Nonviolence
Knowledge required:
Basic internet navigation

                                            Syllabus
                        Module 0. Presentation
Module 1 Human culture. Nomadism to sedentary civilization
Module 2 Breaking the bowl. Civilization crisis
Module 3. Contributions to the emerging culture of nonviolence
Module 4.'s 60s and the emergence of feminism and ecologisms
Module 5. Pacifism, new social movements.
title: Paz y Noviolencia
